Paragraph: The AMI / GI toxicity of celecoxib was similar to that of acetaminophen and seemed to be better than those of rofecoxib and NS - NSAIDs .

2. Acetaminophen: Also known as paracetamol, it is a common over-the-counter medication used for relieving pain and reducing fever.
3. Rofecoxib: This is another selective COX-2 inhibitor, similar to celecoxib, used for treating pain, inflammation, and arthritis.
4. NS-NSAIDs: This stands for non-selective nonsteroidal anti-inflammatory drugs, which are a class of medications that reduce pain, inflammation, and fever. Examples of NS-NSAIDs include ibuprofen, naproxen, and aspirin.
